2202.verse: So when they had passed beyond it, [Moses] said to his boy, "Bring us our morning meal. We have certainly suffered in this, our journey, [much] fatigue."

2203.verse: He said, "Did you see when we retired to the rock? Indeed, I forgot [there] the fish. And none made me forget it except Satan - that I should mention it. And it took its course into the sea amazingly".

2204.verse: [Moses] said, "That is what we were seeking." So they returned, following their footprints.

2205.verse: And they found a servant from among Our servants to whom we had given mercy from us and had taught him from Us a [certain] knowledge.

2206.verse: Moses said to him, "May I follow you on [the condition] that you teach me from what you have been taught of sound judgement?"

2207.verse: He said, "Indeed, with me you will never be able to have patience.

2208.verse: And how can you have patience for what you do not encompass in knowledge?"

2209.verse: [Moses] said, "You will find me, if Allah wills, patient, and I will not disobey you in [any] order."

2210.verse: He said, "Then if you follow me, do not ask me about anything until I make to you about it mention."

2211.verse: So they set out, until when they had embarked on the ship, al-Khidh r tore it open. [Moses] said, "Have you torn it open to drown its people? You have certainly done a grave thing."

2212.verse: [Al-Khidh r] said, "Did I not say that with me you would never be able to have patience?"

2213.verse: [Moses] said, "Do not blame me for what I forgot and do not cover me in my matter with difficulty."

2214.verse: So they set out, until when they met a boy, al-Khidh r killed him. [Moses] said, "Have you killed a pure soul for other than [having killed] a soul? You have certainly done a deplorable thing."
